article.headline: Xavier 72, Mercer 58
article.story: CINCINNATI (AP) -- Anthony Myles scored 15 points in a balanced inside-outside attack Sunday night, and Xavier beat Mercer 72-58 in the semifinals of the Black Coaches Association Classic. Xavier (2-0) will play for the championship of the eight-team tournament on Monday night against Oakland, which beat Illinois-Chicago 79-66 in the other semifinal. Weary of watching Xavier's three guards carry the load, coach Thad Matta had the Musketeers spread the floor and get the ball inside in the second half. Myles had 14 in the half as Xavier pulled away with its newfound balance. The Musketeers' main challenge is to replace national player of the year David West, who gave them 20 points and 12 rebounds a game. Most of the burden will fall on Myles and Will Caudle, who had a career-high eight rebounds. Scott Emerson scored 25 points for Mercer (1-1), which had no chance once the Musketeers went inside. Romain Sato added 14 points for Xavier, Lionel Chalmers had 12 and Dedrick Finn scored 11. For the second consecutive game, Xavier's guards came out firing away from beyond the 3-point arc to get the lead. The Musketeers made their first five 3s -- two by Sato, two by Chalmers, one by Finn -- as they pulled ahead 21-10. Mercer went to a tight man-to-man defense to shut down Xavier's outside game, but couldn't get the lead under three points the rest of the way. Mercer shot 39.3 percent from the field against a defense that held Coppin State to 37 points in the opening round. The Musketeers opened the second half by making it a point of emphasis to get the ball inside. Myles scored a pair of close-up baskets -- and had one shot blocked -- and Caudle had a putback that made it 45-34. Emerson, a 6-foot-9 forward voted the Atlantic Sun Conference's top player in the preseason, kept Mercer in the game by scoring its first six points of the second half. Xavier took control with a 12-1 run that included a reverse layup and a fastbreak layup by Myles that made it 58-43 with eight minutes left. Mercer never seriously challenged again.
